name: Kevin Lewis
tweet: MORE: The Upper Room is free and open to anyone with #PTSD.  •It meets the final Wednesday of every month at 7:30pm. •St. Patrick's Catholic Church in Rockville (4101 Norbeck Road) •No appointment necessary, come as you are. •For more information:  https://www.theupperroomptsd.org/

name: Kevin Lewis
tweet: MORE: The Upper Room's helped veterans, domestic abuse victims + cancer patients with #PTSD.  “There’s a safe place here, and that’s what I need," said Vietnam War vet Ed Smith.  "Recovering from trauma is exhausting, recovering in a vacuum is so hard," said a female participant.  pic.twitter.com/OcxgLH9CMS

name: Kevin Lewis
tweet: MORE: Unlike alcohol/drug addiction, there are few peer support groups for people with #PTSD.  So in 2012, McNulty created just that, naming it 'The Upper Room.'  “I said from day one, ‘If I can help one person because I went through what I went through, then it was worth it.'"  pic.twitter.com/3HTMXZx4F6

name: Kevin Lewis
tweet: Exclusive: Jim McNulty was taken hostage by an eco-terrorist at Discovery Channel HQ in 2010.  “The night I got home, I looked in the mirror and I didn’t recognize the eyes that were looking back at me."  McNulty had developed #PTSD. The condition effects 13 million Americans...  pic.twitter.com/btUIA1I2Sl

name: Rachel Thompson: Has a voice. Uses it.
tweet: You can calm yourself with a mantra:   May you be happy. May you be healthy. May you be at peace. May you be free of suffering.  #Grounding #PTSD #sexabusechat

name: Rachel Thompson: Has a voice. Uses it.
tweet: It's really hard for me to 'just give in' and not go to things because of all this. I refuse to allow the #PTSD to prevent me from living my life. That said, I'm realizing that being constantly overstimulated isn't okay either. #sexabusechat

name: Rachel Thompson: Has a voice. Uses it.
tweet: An easy grounding trick: keep a pony band around your wrist (guys can do this too). Snap it when you feel yourself freaking out over something, or if you're having a flashback or drifting. #PTSD #sexabusechat

name: Rachel Thompson: Has a voice. Uses it.
tweet: same here. That's mostly what I write about in my books -- not understanding or knowing that my reactions to situations were anything but normal for a survivor #PTSD #SexAbuseChat

name: Rachel Thompson: Has a voice. Uses it.
tweet: To review (symptoms of #PTSD)   * Unwanted re-experiencing or reliving of a traumatic event, which may or may not be the result of exposure to specific triggers * A compelling urge to avoid anything that could serve as a trauma trigger  #sexabusechat

name: Rachel Thompson: Has a voice. Uses it.
tweet: By far the most common effect of sexual abuse is #PTSD. Symptoms can extend far into adulthood and can include withdrawn behavior, reenactment of the traumatic event, avoidance of circumstances that remind one of the event, and physiological hyper-reactivity.  #sexabusechat

tweet: Myth #4 Only veterans get #PTSD. Although veterans do get PTSD, any form of trauma can cause it. Including (but not limited to): Natural disaster, terrorist attacks, physical/ sexual violence, traffic accidents (train/bus/car/plane)

tweet: Women are twice as likely to be diagnosed with #PTSD than men are, however women are more likely to be diagnosed with many mental disorders because they are more likely to seek help, and therefore receive a diagnosis.

name: Charlie Webster
tweet: Just turned on @BBCR1 refreshing to hear a mainstream discussion about #PTSD that is getting its facts right. #PTSD can be from any trauma. So important to deal with mental health post trauma. It’s near impossible to go through trauma without mental effects. It’s normal and ok 👌

name: Grace Durbin
tweet: Mini Thread:  To #PTSD survivors.  I don’t believe we’re sick.  I believe we are fearful. I believe we feel guilty. I believe we feel humiliated & broken. I believe we are angry. I believe we are traumatized.   I believe all of those things, but I don’t believe we are sick.
